text:
School of Paediatrics 15th Annual Meeting - 2024
On Thursday 21st November, come and join us for an inspirational day, themed around “Empowering the Voice of the Parent and Child”

Why not sign up for the Associate Principal Investigator (API) scheme sponsored by NIHR? 

Would you like to publish a literature review or letter to a journal - send us an email and we will support you to get started.

bridge.paedsresearch.yh@gmail.com
There is a great 2-day “Research for the Specialty Trainee” course available via Maxcourse

The Royal College has a very good Systematic Reviews available on RCPCH online learning

RCPCH Research Day: “From curiosity to discovery: research essentials for paediatricians in training” comes up on 3rd December 2024. Register here

Trainee Research nEtwork Education Seminars (TREES) are held every last Tuesday of the month at 1 pm. Sign up here

Bridge Paediatrics is a research forum for Paediatric Postgraduate Doctors in Training (PGDiT) in Yorkshire and Humber, run by PGDiT


Check out the previous research training for clinician videos collated on the Previous Research Training Videos Tab


Get in touch via e-mail with:


bridge.paedsresearch.yh@gmail.com


Next event: Clinical Questions Suitable for the RCPCH e-Portfolio - Dr Anna Fox, Paediatric Consultant. Use this link to access the event via Microsoft Teams



Join us 1400hrs 5th December 2024 for “How Technology is Changing Paediatric Research” - Professor Paul Dimitri, Vice President for Science and Research for the Royal College of Paediatrics and Child Health.



In January of the New Year of 2025, we can look forward to a paediatric allergy focused journal club with Dr Vibha Sharma, a Consultant in Paediatric Allergy from the Royal Manchester Children’s Hospital.



In February 2025, look forward to “Insights into the writing of book chapters - How to get involved and succeed” - Professor Will Carroll, Author of “The Illustrated Textbook of Paediatrics”, amongst a plethora of other books and journal articles.


Join the conversation with us on X via the handle:



BridgePaedsR_yh

title: About
text: This is a research forum for Paediatric Postgraduate Doctors in Training (PGDiT) in Yorkshire and Humber, run by PGDiT

Bridge Paediatrics is a research forum for Paediatric Postgraduate Doctors in Training (PGDiT) in Yorkshire and Humber, run by PGDiT. Get in touch via e-mail with:

bridge.paedsresearch.yh@gmail.com



Chair Persons


Co-chair Dyanne Imo-Ivoke (ST4, Future Leaders Programme OOPE, East Yorkshire)


Dyanne is a paediatric trainee with an interest in neonatology and medical education. Dyanne is currently a Future Leaders Fellow for NHS England, Yorkshire and Humber.





Co-chair - Verena Walsh (ST5, East Yorkshire)



Verena is a paediatric trainee interested in Neonatology, Quality Improvement and Systematic Review Methodology. She completed an Academic Clinical Fellowship in Yorkshire and Humber (2017-2020) and a HEE Future Leaders Programme (2020-2021).






Website development


Neil Lawrence (ST4, OOPR/NIHR Doctoral Research Fellow - South Yorkshire)
Neil is a paediatric trainee keen to pursue a special interest in Cardiology. Whilst working on a PhD applying data science to real world registry data, Neil is also a clinical fellow for the software team at the Medicines and Healthcare Regulatory Agency, and is interested in improving the application of technology in everyday paediatric practice.
